intro: Aeluropus pungens, commonly known as the sharpgrass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and sharp, spiky leaves. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Aeluropus pungens is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Its resilience makes it an important component of desert and coastal ecosystems.
